text: The New Canada Party was a short-lived Canadian political party that nominated one candidate, party founder and leader, Fred Reiner, in the 1968 election. Reiner ran in Toronto—Rosedale riding under the slogan, "Canada for Canadians", and received 148 votes, or 0.4% of the total. Reiner, a construction superintendent born in Bavaria, Germany, claimed to have organized the party in 1963. ==See also== *Politics of Canada ==References== Parliament of Canada History of the Federal Electoral Ridings since 1867, Toronto Star, June 1968. Category:Federal political parties in Canada
title: New Canada Party
